instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: Mac A1502 820-4924-a No Keyboard no Trackpad
threads.message:
PP3V3_S5 3.3v
PP3V3_S4 0.1v
PP3V3_S4_FET_R is missing on U8000... u8000 Bad?

Edit: Reflowed u8000 now i got 1.1v on PP3V3_S4

threads.title: Mac A1502 820-4924-a No Keyboard no Trackpad
threads.message:
Diode mode to ground on 3V3_S4_FET?
If OK and also =P3V3S4_EN is present, then change U8000.
If no good, check disconnecting RIO power connector and trackpad flex.

threads.title: Mac A1502 820-4924-a No Keyboard no Trackpad
threads.message:
Diode mode 3V3_S4_FET 0.104

It's strange now i get IN and OUT voltage on U8000.

all measured just board plugged in

threads.title: Mac A1502 820-4924-a No Keyboard no Trackpad
Mac A1502 820-4924-a No Keyboard no Trackpad
Mac A1502 820-4924-a No Keyboard no Trackpad
threads.message: Wait, your board has non working TP/KB or is not starting at all???

threads.title: Mac A1502 820-4924-a No Keyboard no Trackpad
threads.message: The board was powering on and now All magically started working trackpad and keyboard... testing now but all seems good :D Thanks 2informaticos

threads.title: Mac A1502 820-4924-a No Keyboard no Trackpad
threads.message: Clean both terminals of TP flex, as its connectors too.
